n=2 EQUALITY (UNCONDITIONAL PROOF):

For n=2, p(x) = (x-a)(x-b) with a < b, gap g_p = b-a.
H_p(a) = 1/(a-b) = -1/g_p, H_p(b) = 1/(b-a) = 1/g_p.
So Phi_2(p) = 1/g_p^2 + 1/g_p^2 = 2/g_p^2, and 1/Phi_2(p) = g_p^2/2.

MSS convolution at n=2: With p(x) = x^2 + a_1 x + a_2, q(x) = x^2 + b_1 x + b_2:
  c_0 = 1, c_1 = a_1 + b_1, c_2 = a_2 + a_1 b_1/2 + b_2.
  Discriminant of r: c_1^2 - 4c_2 = (a_1+b_1)^2 - 4(a_2 + a_1 b_1/2 + b_2)
  = a_1^2 + 2a_1 b_1 + b_1^2 - 4a_2 - 2a_1 b_1 - 4b_2
  = (a_1^2 - 4a_2) + (b_1^2 - 4b_2) = g_p^2 + g_q^2.

Therefore gap(r)^2 = g_p^2 + g_q^2 (Pythagorean identity), and:
  1/Phi_2(r) = gap(r)^2/2 = (g_p^2 + g_q^2)/2 = g_p^2/2 + g_q^2/2 = 1/Phi_2(p) + 1/Phi_2(q).

EQUALITY holds for ALL p, q in P_2. QED.

Note: This proof is completely unconditional â€” it does not depend on the main inequality.
